primarySegments.name: Young Urban Professionals
primarySegments.description: Tech-savvy young adults living in urban areas who prioritize personal safety and are early adopters of new technology.

problemsNeeds: Concerned about personal safety in urban environments
Need quick and discreet ways to alert contacts during emergencies
behaviors: Likely to download and test new apps
Use the app during late-night commutes or travel
Share app with friends and family for safety

primarySegments.name: Elderly Living Independently
primarySegments.description: Senior citizens who live alone and seek easy-to-use solutions to stay connected and safe.

problemsNeeds: Fear of falling or medical emergencies without immediate help
Need a simple way to alert family or caregivers
Desire peace of mind for themselves and their families
behaviors: Use the app as a safety net during daily activities
Rely on family members to set up and explain the app
Regularly check app functionality for reassurance

primarySegments.name: Parents of Young Children
primarySegments.description: Parents who prioritize the safety of their children and seek tools to ensure rapid response in emergencies.

problemsNeeds: Worry about emergencies when children are away from home
Need a reliable way for children to alert parents
Desire easy-to-use safety tools for kids
behaviors: Teach children how to use the app
Use the app during family outings or when children are at school
Share app with other parents for community safety
